Control Name: 5.5.6 Access to data storage is identity-based, whenever possible.
Control Statement: Protecting data at rest is required to maintain confidentiality, integrity, and availability assurances across all workloads. Cloud service providers make multiple methods of access control available - shared keys, shared signatures, anonymous access, identity provider-based. Identity provider methods (such as AAD and RBAC) are the least liable to compromise and enable more fine-grained role-based access controls.
